body: This PR can be closed with #305 being merged.
Closing this, as it was superseded by #305
Thanks @keith-turner. I've rendered the javadocs for all versions on my local machine and they render correctly.
I can merge this.  @jmark99  does #307 currently have the changes you want for 1.8?  If so I will look at that when merging forward.

Yes, @keith-turner , #307 has the correct documentation for 1.8. This documentation is also valid for the current master line of development. These was a slight modification to the loadDefaults() method between 1.7 and 1.8 that necessitated a small change to the documentation.
@jmark99 I squashed+merged the changes.   There was one diff, I ran mvn compile and it reformatted some stuff.
This is closed by 63f5713708900e50b2177405be699cd4d07e97a0

ACCUMULO-4722 Use Objects.equals in Pairs class

Made an additional update to Pairs.java replacing the private hashCode method with Objects.hashCode(). I compared the performance of Objects.hash(Object... values) vs Objects.hashCode(Object o) prior to making the update and noticed that in my local tests the use of Objects.hashCode was noticeably faster than Objects.hash.
If we can, we want to grab compressed data before it is written to disk. This way we insert controls on the file size without speculating about the results of compression.

@asfbot went crazy and started replying to its own replies to the notification list, in an endless loop. Infra took a look and I think the problem is resolved now. I've tried to delete the spammy comments from @asfbot ; Hopefully the comment thread is cleaner now. I'll try to clean up the JIRA worklog later, because that got spammed, too. Can't do anything about the notifications list, though.
@jmark99 Looks good.  You finished with updates?  I can merge your changes if so.
Hi Keith, yes it can be merged. Thanks!
Thanks, Mike.
For some reason, this PR isn't updating JIRA. I think JIRA integration might be broken again. Mentioning ACCUMULO-4731 should update https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ACCUMULO-4731

@PircDef how did you generate the binary kek files in resources?  If it all possible it would be best if the test generated these.   One possibility is to gen them in target dir, I can dig up some test code that shows how to get the target dir in a test if you are interested.
Updated with javadoc and since tag on new method.
This actually doesn't even change any file formatting. Neon and Oxygen formatters were basically the same, if not identical.

Squashed and merged this in e875f01ed519100225bdf3a1550c40caccd8521f

Thanks for the contribution @PircDef.  Would you like to added to the Accumulo people page.  If so let me know what info you would like added or submit a PR to the accumulo-website repo modifying the people page.
Merged and squashed in daeffd8d9cf980814fb7d131a0d89cbdfd856298
Merged and squashed in 314f9f2b2f70d28a52cb699e1c65b85e4d6be7e3

@PircDef it would be nice to update the release notes w/ info about these new config.  https://github.com/apache/accumulo-website/blob/master/_posts/release/2017-09-05-accumulo-2.0.0.md
Would you be interested in doing this?

fyi, soft references are notorious for causing bad performance in heavily loaded systems. They increase the number of full GCs due to heap pollution and will be evicted when low on memory, which can cause thrashing. Not sure I understand well enough to advise except to always question whether a usage is justified.

> fyi, soft references are notorious for causing bad performance in heavily loaded systems.

I may be able to redesign that.  How does Caffeine handle the weight of an entry changing?

We require that the user update the entry using the cache so that it can
reevaluate the weight. That could be a put or computation. The weight is
stored with the entry and not re-evaluated on eviction.

wrote:

> loaded systems.

What's the status of this?

I squashed these commits into 9cd4be0432c7b0297d86b19ddeac64ed0feaea87 and pushed that to master.  I ran `mvn verify -DskipITs` and it did some slight reformatting which is included in 9cd4be0432c7b0297d86b19ddeac64ed0feaea87
I would like to be added to the people page the info I want is just my name Jared R. Thanks.
I added Jared R. to people page.

Everything builds successfully for me locally.  I'm not sure what the deal is with the travis build, is there a way to kick it off again & have it run a full build?

Otherwise there did not appear to be any further requested changes and I believe it's good to go.
@glitch I can't reproduce the compiler error in Travis, either. I re-kicked the build in Travis.
The only thing I can think of regarding the failure is that it has something to do with PowerMock. Do we need to use PowerMock for the WebViewsTest? Or will EasyMock on its own suffice?

I needed PowerMock because EasyMock couldn't mock static methods (i.e. in the WebViewsTest needed to mock the Monitor.getContext() method to return a different mocked/stub context).

I can get rid of those specific tests using Powermock but I don't have anything to replace them with.
Hmm, I see. Well, maybe we can skip this test on Travis only?

~~Ah, I got this to break locally with the right mvn incantation (was running the sunny day tests instead of the mvn clean verify -DskipITs that travis is running).  I'll see if I can get a workaround over Thanksgiving holiday; otherwise I can add an Ignore annotation or gut the PowerMock test.~~

I noticed that my branch is pretty far behind master at this point and it looks like the real issue is that the Table.ID inner class actually changed (ACCUMULO-4681).  Previously it has a public constructor and now it appears to have a private one hence the test failure.  Those changes looked like they were merged a couple of weeks after my original PR was posted.  I'll take a look over Thanksgiving and see if I can get this working again.  As it stands it should not be merged.

The current branch is still internally consistent. The change in the master branch would only matter if one of those classes were somehow getting on the class path, which they shouldn't be. But, it is possible that the changes in master are more compatible with the mocking mechanism.
@ctubbsii Check out fae6c8a and let me know what you think.  Creating a POJO and using the ObjectMapper seemed like the cleanest approach.

Here is a site file that I tested with: 
[accumulo-site-json-monitor.txt](https://github.com/apache/accumulo/files/1493437/accumulo-site-json-monitor.txt)

Brief update:  The version of Jetty was changed recently to 9.3.21.v20170918.  This caused some internal dependency issues with jersey test framework (master's current jersey.version is 2.25.1 which carries a jetty dependency on version 9.2.14.v20151106).  There is no current jersey.version which matches master's jetty dependency (jersey skips from jetty 9.2.14 up to 9.4.3.v20170317 in 2.26-b03->4).

That aside I was able to rebase all commits, update code issues with class changes, and switch the jersey test provider from jetty to grizzly2 and all tests are passing now.

The last thing I have to do is test the full runtime locally.  Assuming it pans out, I'll force push over the Accumulo-4677 branch with the squashed commit for folks to look at again.  Thanks!

Some good news, running locally the path validation looks to be working correctly (although the validation messages leave a bit to be desired).

That said I think I may have found some bugs in the monitor itself regarding some of the links (i.e. localhost:9995/tables/ displays tables but the hyperlink path ends with [object Object] instead of the table id).

In any case, assuming the Travis build is clean and no-one spots any other errors / assembly problems (fixed the el-impl one). I think this can be considered done for the initial validation capability.

Yep, some of the hyperlinks for table paths are busted on master branch for the accumulo-monitor.
Logged ticket https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ACCUMULO-4745

> I think I may have found some bugs in the monitor itself regarding some of the links (i.e. localhost:9995/tables/ displays tables but the hyperlink path ends with [object Object]

+1 For the new ticket you created.  I noticed this while working on ACCUMULO-4739 but forgot to create a ticket.  Thanks!
I thought I saw a comment from @ctubbsii but I don't see it here? Perhaps it was lost in your last rebase... either way, if he is good with this PR, I can merge it.

I think we found a good solution with the JSON String map.  It is flexible enough to include whatever HTML tags are needed but with a fairly simple implementation.  The only tricky part is an Admin will have to remember to wrap the JSON in CDATA tags.  Otherwise the XML parsing will confuse the JSON HTML for XML configuration. 

A nice side effect of using the CDATA tags is that you don't have to escape the embedded HTML.  Here is a configuration that mirrors the current resources: 
[accumulo-site-xml.txt](https://github.com/apache/accumulo/files/1507503/accumulo-site-xml.txt)
...and more conflicts & test failures because the underlying WebViews class changed again, lol.

Ok, I renamed the test class to WebViewsIT and moved it into the accumulo-test module under its own package (org.apache.accumulo.test.monitor) and annotated with the SunnyDayTests @Category annotation.  I also updated the various pom dependencies accordingly (basically moving the test scope deps from accumulo-monitor pom to accumulo-test pom etc.)  The issue with the rawtypes versus generic types has also been fixed on the internal test HashMapWriter stub.

I'm still waiting for the ITs to finish locally but I think he has everything folks wanted.

Let me know if there is something else, I don't mind fixing it and getting it in the correct spot.  I also don't mind if someone wants to touch it up later.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

@glitch Sorry for the conflicts, I had wrapped up ACCUMULO-4739 yesterday but missed a few updates. My changes to WebViews should be isolated to the new method I created though.  I will put off the rest of the changes I wanted to make to the Monitor until we can get this merged up.
@glitch If you want me to fix the conflicts for you, just let me know.  I can check out the PR, squash and merge it all up since your work looks complete.
I think i fixed the dependency issues with test pom with d3cf72f but the WevViewsiT is still failing.

@milleruntime Looks like there are conflicts again on the WebViews class.
I can look at this again tonight along with the test failures.  If you have further changes to the WebViews class etc. go ahead and make them and let me know when they are done so I can resolve all of it at once.  Thanks!

> If you have further changes to the WebViews class etc. go ahead and make them and let me know when they are done

Nope, good to go!
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

The Travis build from my commit last night passed: https://travis-ci.org/apache/accumulo/builds/308707934
But it didn't run the ITs.  

When I run WebViewsIT by itself (mvn clean verify -Dit.test=WebViewsIT -Dtest=foo -Dfindbugs.skip -Dcheckstyle.skip -DfailIfNoTests=false) I get the wrong HTTP status returned in 2 of the tests:
```
WebViewsIT.testGetTablesConstraintViolations:85 should return status 400 expected:<400> but was:<500>
WebViewsIT.testGetTracesSummaryValidationConstraint:129 should return status 400 expected:<400> but was:<500>
```
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
@keith-turner I can take a look at this.  I want to checkout your branch though so I can see the bug.

I don't know why this fails Travis build but my local build passes when ran through uno, I guess it skips certain test. Does anyone know how I can stop that from happening? Would rather make sure it passes locally than push each time.

Travis-ci runs all the tests but skipsITs.  Try running this locally:
```mvn clean verify -DskipITs```
Okay will do that, after this next push I did fails since I didn't know that beforehand. Thanks.

Was there a consensus on this change for 2.0? I can't tell from the comments if there is a strong opposition or just a lengthy discussion.  If this isn't going to be merged, I think it should be closed since its over a year old.
@rweeks Can I close this PR?  Looking at the feedback on the JIRA ticket, I take it folks were not comfortable with this change or felt that it was out of scope to include in Accumulo.
@milleruntime I don't think we reached consensus. I'll close the PR for now, and leave the issue open and maybe revisit it later.
@phrocker are you planning on finishing this any time soon?  If not, I will close the PR for now.
@keith-turner Should I do the changes referred above ?
@milleruntime it was finished, but not merged. If I have an opportunity to make sure it works ( I would never assume something still works after 8 months ha ) I'll merge. Thanks.

OK sounds good.  If you don't get to it over the next week, maybe someone else can test it.

@keith-turner were all your questions addressed?

@bfach10 I was doing some testing and noticed this is happening on other pages as well.  I believe we have the same issue in these classes:

ProblemSummaryInformation
ProblemDetailInformation

If no one objects over the next week, I will close this pull request.
Merged in ed313f7

@milleruntime I think it's fine to close now. This PR was never intended to be merged. It can always be re-opened if there is consensus on including the feature in a future version, and the PR is updated with new merge-ready commits.
merged in 26e83f05d1448631f0b8a0da1b8671abe9beb922

@milleruntime happy to work on those classes as well. Just keep it in this ticket?
Yeah I think that is fine.  You could also use the same branch and pull request.  Then we can squash your changes into one commit.
Great glad to hear that. alrighty.

Ok, this looks like it's passing locally now.  The culprit was some missing dependencies for the bean validation stuff to wire itself correctly.

This worked:  `mvn clean verify -Dit.test=WebViewsIT -Dtest=foo -Dfindbugs.skip -Dcheckstyle.skip -DfailIfNoTests=false`

As well as `mvn verify -Psunny`
Thanks @glitch !  I will merge this
@keith-turner  Done ! plz review

I spoke with @ctubbsii briefly and I think he is OK with these changes.  He mentioned an idea to make the Monitor code more resilient to future changes but that can be follow on work. I will go ahead and merge these changes.

@bfach10 thanks for the contribution!  If you would like to be added to the list of [contributors](https://accumulo.apache.org/people/#contributors), please create a pull request against the [website](https://github.com/apache/accumulo-website) and we can add you.

Thanks for the patch, @bfach10 ; @milleruntime was right, I'm ok OK with these changes.

I created a separate, follow-on issue at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ACCUMULO-4755 in case somebody's interested in the idea @milleruntime  mentioned that I had.
